etymology.description: 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") + 恩(恩) (ēn) = vocal sound -> mm-hmm; uh-huh
etymology.interpretation: The character 嗯(嗯) (èn, "mm-hmm; uh-huh") combines the semantic element 口(口) (kǒu, "mouth") to indicate a sound made with the mouth, with 恩(恩) (ēn) as the phonetic component. This highlights the character's function to represent a vocal expression like 'mm-hmm' or 'uh-huh'.

examples.chinese: 嗯(嗯)，我听懂了(我聽懂了)。
他点头表示(他點頭表示)，嗯(嗯)，同意了(同意了)。
examples.pinyin: tā diǎn tóu biǎo shì, èn, tóng yì le.
